section.title: How To Disable The "Active Content" Warning In Internet Explorer 6.0 (SP2)
section.paragraph: Internet Explorer prevents files containing JavaScript from executing on your local machine by default.

To disable this behavior, click on the "Tools" menu in Internet Explorer and choose "Internet Options..." from the resulting menu. When the "Internet Options" dialog opens, click on the "Advanced" tab and scroll through the list of settings to find the "Security" heading. Within this setting, locate the checkbox with the text "Allow active content to run in files on My Computer". Click the checkbox to enable it and click "OK" to apply the setting.
This document should now display without warnings.
